------------------------@1828-------------------------
if, else if, else question
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>Are these two if else if statements the same. For the second one, will return 0 execute if one of the conditional statements above was executed?</p>
<pre><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span>(<span class="hljs-comment">/*condition*/</span>){
  <span class="hljs-comment">// code</span>
}
<span class="hljs-keyword">else</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span>(<span class="hljs-comment">/*condition*/</span>) {
  <span class="hljs-comment">// code</span>
}
<span class="hljs-keyword">else</span> {
  <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-number">0</span>;
}

<span class="hljs-comment">//////////////////</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span>(<span class="hljs-comment">/*condition*/</span>){
  <span class="hljs-comment">// code</span>
}
<span class="hljs-keyword">else</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span>(<span class="hljs-comment">/*condition*/</span>) {
  <span class="hljs-comment">// code</span>
}
<span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-number">0</span>;
<div class="compile_code"><button class="compile_code_button" data-id="compileCodeBtnId" onclick="return PE.openCodeRunner('');">run code snippet</button><div class="code_runner_notify">Visit Manage Class to disable runnable code snippets<button onclick="return PE.dismissCodeRunnerNotice();">×</button></div></div></pre></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Yep! These would be equivalent. Either way, if the <code>if</code> is false and the <code>else if</code> is also false, it returns 0.</p></div>

------------------------@1829-------------------------
play_card trump question.
<p>I am unsure where to use the variable trump that is passed into play_card for simple player. The specs say "If a Simple Player can follow suit, they play the highest card that follows suit. Otherwise, they play the lowest card in their hand." </p>


<p></p>


<p>Doesn't this only rely on led_card, and cant you determine highest card that follows suit without using trump? </p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>If the player doesn’t have the led suit, then the player will need to use trump to determine what their lowest card is. For example, if Spades is trump and diamonds were led, and the players hand is just the 9 of spades and the 10 of hearts, the player knowing the trump suit would play the 10 of hearts instead of the 9 of spades even though the rank is technically lower.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Why do we want to play 10 of hearts, even though 9 of spades is lower?</p>


<p></p>


<p>In the same case where the Player doesn't have a led suit, when do we specifically consider the lowest card in their hand?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Because the trump suit is Spades, this automatically makes the 9 of spades higher than any other card, besides the right bower and any other spades that is higher.</p>


<p></p>


<p><a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#value-of-cards" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#value-of-cards</a></p>


<p></p>


<p>refer to the image that shows the rank of the cards when there is a trump and led suit. </p>


<p></p>


<p>As to your second question, if the simple player doesnt have a led suit, you always consider the lowest card in their hand because that is what they are going to play.  This is only for the simple player, for human player, they can decide to play any card. </p>

------------------------@1830-------------------------
confused about pack constructors
<p>I am very confused about pack constructors. From what I understand, for the default constructor, we have to initialize each element in the cards array to be in order from 9 of spades to the ace of diamonds. and we have to manually initlaize each element in cards array. I have a nested for loop to loop through and making the cards in order using the ranks by weight and suits by weight arrays. but I don't understand how to use an initializer list when using loops. </p>


<p></p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>It is not required to use an initializer list for adding Cards to the <code>cards</code> array. Typically, initializer lists are meant for quickly initializing member variables (ie. <code>next</code>), not adding a bunch of elements to an array.</p></div>

------------------------@1840-------------------------
call to 'swap' error
<p><img alt="Screen_Shot_2022-10-08_at_1.26.00_PM.png" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fkss10t2wxtr739%2F93abbf86193a9f3a958a8ceb57e692eee052be690601c1b8330ec73e3d149f1f%2FScreen_Shot_2022-10-08_at_1.26.00_PM.png"/></p>


<p>I keep getting this issue, "No matching function for call to 'swap.'" Does anyone know what this means?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p><strong>EDIT: SEE FOLLOWUP</strong></p>
<p>If you’re calling <code>swap</code> directly in your code, make sure the type of both arguments is the same.</p>
<p>Otherwise, this might be coming from improper use of <code>std::sort()</code>? Make sure that the sort function takes <code>vec_name.begin()</code> and <code>vec_name.end()</code> as parameters. If this isn’t the issue, please make an AG submission so we can check your code by hand (or come into OH on Sunday if you don’t want to use an AG submit).</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>For anyone who encounters something similar (gigantic error message that stems from ), the issue is that <code>make_trump</code> is const. Calling <code>std::sort</code> within <code>make_trump</code> will result in this error because <code>std::sort</code> modifies its input. Adding to FAQ.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Thank you so much!</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>So we should sort in our euchre.cpp file before we call make trump? </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>So we should use sort in our euchre.cpp file before we call make trump? </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo2ooY"><p>You shouldn’t need to use <code>sort</code> in <code>euchre.cpp</code>, since the only thing we sort is the Player’s hand. This should be done in <code>Player.cpp</code> if necessary.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>I am just confused on how to sort the hand before printing it in make_trump then. Should I just make a temporary vector, add the elements from lowest to highest from hand and print that? </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Yes</p>

------------------------@1841-------------------------
what functions do we implement in player? all of the those in the .h? also which shld we start with

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You need to create two derived classes from the abstract <code>Player</code> class. So you’ll have two different <code>Player</code> classes that each implement all of the functions in <code>Player</code> that need to be overridden. You will also need to override the factory function.</p>
<p>I would start with the <code>Simple</code> player implementation since that’s what we’re checking most thoroughly on the checkpoint due Monday.</p></div>

------------------------@1842-------------------------
Next not changing value
<p>Hello, when I'm trying to debug my deal_one function I'm noticing that the "next" variable is not changing. To increment the value, I'm just using next++. Any idea on why it would not be changing?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Are you doing the increment after the return? If you do the increment after the return, the function will end before reaching the increment and said increment won’t take effect.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>How can you increment next after returning if you need to return first? </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Save the card you wish to return, increment next, then return the card. Anything you do after the return will not execute.</p>

------------------------@1844-------------------------
play_card example
<p>Suppose the led suit is diamonds and the trump is hearts. If the hand has a left bower (Jack of Diamonds), is that card still considered to be the same suit as the led card?  I am basically asking if a card with a diamond suit that is not a jack would get higher priority than the Jack of Diamonds when playing a card.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>No - the left bower is of the trump suit. So all other diamond cards would be below the Jack of Diamonds in this case.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Just to clarify, for the same conditions, a hand consists of a Jack of Diamonds (left bower) and a Ten of Diamonds. In this case, a simple player would play the card Ten of Diamonds (highest led card) since the Jack of Diamonds is considered trump.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>Correct.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1845-------------------------
cards public test
<div><br/>
<div>    Card three_spades = Card(Card::RANK_THREE, Card::SUIT_SPADES);</div>
<div>    ASSERT_EQUAL(three_spades.get_rank(), Card::RANK_THREE);</div>
<div>    ASSERT_EQUAL(three_spades.get_suit(), Card::SUIT_SPADES);</div>
<div>    ASSERT_EQUAL(three_spades.get_suit(Card::SUIT_CLUBS), Card::SUIT_SPADES);</div>
</div>


<p></p>


<p>I have a question on the third test,</p>


<p>"</p>


<div>    ASSERT_EQUAL(three_spades.get_suit(Card::SUIT_CLUBS), Card::SUIT_SPADES);</div>


<p>"</p>


<p><br/>Why should this equal spades?<br/><br/>My logic is that the card is a 3 of spades, and since the trump suit is clubs, this function should return clubs because spades is of the same color as clubs, the trump suit. </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>The 3 of spades is considered a spade even though the trump is the next (same color but different) suit.</p>
<p>You may be mixing up logic surrounding the left bower - the left bower (card with same color as the trump suit) is part of the trump suit, but all other cards with same color / different suit from the trump are NOT trump suit.</p></div>

------------------------@1846-------------------------
Card_less (last function in card.cpp)
<p>is a card only less than another card if both suit and rank are less? or would a card also be considered less than only by its rank (if they have the same suit)?</p>


<p></p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#value-of-cards should explain this. In short, consider trump, then consider led, then consider rank, then consider suit.</p></div>

------------------------@1848-------------------------
std::array
<p>The Pack class has a member variable of type std::array, and I was wondering how this differed from the built-in arrays. What would be the conventional good-practice when initializing them in the constructor? </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p><code>std::array</code> is just a wrapper class for C-style arrays (what we’ve discussed in class). In the constructor for Pack, you should just treat it as if you have an array <code>Card cards[24]</code> (C-style array of cards, size 24).</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

does the simple player's hand need to be sorted or just the human?

-------------------------------------------------
<p>I believe only the human player's hand needs to be sorted before you print it. However, you can sort the simple player's hand if your method of removing cards from it requires.</p>

------------------------@1853-------------------------
confusion on round 2 of simple player make trump
<p>can someone explain round 2 of make trump for the simple player? they chose to upcard if they have 1 or more cards of the upcard's next suit? but what if they have the same suit as upcard? and what about the right and left bower of the upcard suit?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>For the second round of make trump, you only consider the upcard’s next suit. The right and left bower of the upcard’s next suit count as the upcard’s next suit.</p></div>

------------------------@1854-------------------------
Regarding call to 'swap' error

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Ah, I see. So you’re trying to sort the hand on line 135 of Player.cpp - this is an invalid operation because <code>make_trump</code> is const. You cannot call sort specifically in this function - you have to sort somewhere where you don’t have the const restriction.</p></div>

------------------------@1857-------------------------
test_Card_less_self

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>A segmentation fault is casued by accessing memory that is out of bounds - Check that your loops are correct and that you aren’t going where you shouldn’t be. Address sanitizer will help with finding what line or call is calling this, you can set it up using <a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_asan.html" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">this tutorial</a>.</p></div>

------------------------@1864-------------------------
Syntax check
<p>I wrote the following for a helper method to use in my shuffle function: </p>


<div>
<pre>	<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">void</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">static</span> <span class="hljs-title">in_shuffle</span><span class="hljs-params">(<span class="hljs-built_in">std</span>::<span class="hljs-built_in">array</span>&lt;Card, <span class="hljs-number">24</span>&gt; cards)</span> </span>{
    <span class="hljs-built_in">std</span>::<span class="hljs-built_in">array</span>&lt;Card, 24&gt; shuffled_deck;
    <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">int</span> i=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>; i&lt;<span class="hljs-number">24</span>; i+=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>) {
        shuffled_deck.at(i) = cards.at(i);
        shuffled_deck.at(i+<span class="hljs-number">1</span>) = cards.at(<span class="hljs-number">1</span>+<span class="hljs-number">12</span>);
    }
    cards = shuffled_deck; 
}<div class="compile_code"><button class="compile_code_button" data-id="compileCodeBtnId" onclick="return PE.openCodeRunner('');">run code snippet</button><div class="code_runner_notify">Visit Manage Class to disable runnable code snippets<button onclick="return PE.dismissCodeRunnerNotice();">×</button></div></div></pre><p>intended to perform 1 faro in-shuffle when called. However, I came to realize that when defining an array object, I needed to specify its size. I couldn't access the private member variables of the Pack class with this external method, so I just hard-coded 24 as the size of the intended parameter, I wasn't sure if this was good practice. I would appreciate some feedback on the rest of the usage of the array wrapper class as well (Where can I find more information about this wrapper class? I do not remember where in the lecture this was discussed)</p>
</div>


<p></p>


<p>Additionally, would it be fine to just leave the shuffled_deck object without deleting it? I tried delete shuffled_deck; but it gave me a compiler error.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<ol><li>Hard-coding the 24 is usually not good practice, but it's not going to cause any problems. Good practice is making some sort of const global variable representing the pack size, but like I said, it's not necessary. </li><li>You can find information about the array class <a href="https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/container/array" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">here</a>.</li><li>The shuffled_deck obj automatically deletes itself as it goes out of scope. Remember we only need a delete keyword if there is a corresponding new keyword.</li></ol>


<p></p>

------------------------@1865-------------------------
How to index into RANK_BY_WEIGHT/SUIT
<p>What is the syntax for indexing into RANK_BY_WEIGHT for lhs and rhs. My compiler is giving me errors if I try something like RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[lhs.get_rank()]</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>It’s just like any other array. You put an integer between 0 and the size of the array in the square brackets to get an element. For example</p>
<pre><code>RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[1] == "Three"
</code></pre><p>What you are thinking of in your example is <code>std::find</code>, which we are not allowed to use.</p></div>

------------------------@1867-------------------------
Clock skew detected
<p> I am getting this error when I try to make Card_test.exe : warning:  Clock skew detected.  Your build may be incomplete. I can still run my tests and it does not seem to affect anything, but what does the warning mean and how do I get rid of it?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
The warning means the time set on your computer and the filesystem are different - its detecting that the files last modified time is in the future compared to the system time, which shouldn't be right. However, as you said it's mostly harmless.

------------------------@1868-------------------------
how do u remove an element from the vector
<p>/ what are the arguments for it because .erase(index) doesnt work</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>To remove an element using erase, you have to use the <code>vector.begin()</code> iterator + the index you want to remove. See this documentation for more details: <a href="https://cplusplus.com/reference/vector/vector/erase/" target="_blank">https://cplusplus.com/reference/vector/vector/erase/</a>.</p></div>

------------------------@1869-------------------------
Mem leaks in public test
<p>When I run ASAN I get memory leaks in Pack_public_tests, should I be worried about this or should I just ignore it since the public tests aren't written by us? </p>


<p>Follow up question is there any time we need to delete the cards/pack besides the test files?</p>


<p></p>


<p>Another follow up, I am now getting a mem leak in the pack default constructor, but I am using delete after I initialize "cards".</p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You shouldn’t be using dynamic memory (<code>new</code>, <code>delete</code>, etc.) outside of <code>Player_factory()</code>. As described in the spec under <a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#requirements-and-restrictions" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">Requirements and Restrictions</a>:</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>DO NOT</strong>: Dynamic memory (<code>new</code>, <code>malloc()</code>, etc.) outside of the <code>Player_factory</code>.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Card objects don’t need to be pointers or created using <code>new Card</code>, just declare them as normal objects:</p>
<pre>Card c(rank, suit);
<span class="hljs-comment">// not:</span>
Card* c = <span class="hljs-keyword">new</span> Card;
c-&gt;rank = rank;
c-&gt;suit = suit;
<div class="compile_code"><button class="compile_code_button" data-id="compileCodeBtnId" onclick="return PE.openCodeRunner('Q2FyZCUyMGMocmFuaywlMjBzdWl0KTslMEEvLyUyMG5vdDolMEFDYXJkKiUyMGMlMjA9JTIwbmV3JTIwQ2FyZDslMEFjLSUzRXJhbmslMjA9JTIwcmFuazslMEFjLSUzRXN1aXQlMjA9JTIwc3VpdDslMEE=');">run code snippet</button><div class="code_runner_notify">Visit Manage Class to disable runnable code snippets<button onclick="return PE.dismissCodeRunnerNotice();">×</button></div></div></pre><p>This may have gotten you because all of p2 was written with the latter style. You should fix this as it will dock points in the grader - as a general rule of thumb public tests are always right and should run without any hitches.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1876-------------------------
how can you remove an element from an array?
<p>or how do i move it to the back?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>For a <code>std::array</code>, there is no easy way to remove an element from an array in one step. You’d likely have to make another array of smaller size and copy everything but your excluded element into there.</p>
<p>To instead move an element to the back, you’d just have to swap two elements of the array(the target element and the last element). To implement this, you’d get a variable to store the value of the target, then make the value at the target location in the array the same as the end of the array, and finally make the value at the end of the array the variable you stored before (or do something similar).</p>
<p>If you instead use a vector, it’s much easier. Just do <code>vector_name.erase(vector_name.begin() + index_to_erase)</code>. More details <a href="https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/container/vector/erase" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">here</a>.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1877-------------------------
testing ranks not within euchre deck
<p>Hi, should we be testing cards 2-8? I'm not sure since the euchre deck technically has cards 9-10 and then faces and aces</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Nope, you won’t need to. They’re just there to show the completeness of the <code>Card</code> class and give you ideas on how this could be used to implement more games than just Euchre.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1878-------------------------
lead card
<p>for lead card does the left bower count as trump too? what if the lead suit is the left bower?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>The left bower is considered as trump for all purposes within the course of the game after trump is declared. If the lead suit is the left bower’s original suit, the left bower does not count as the original suit. For example, if trump is hearts and the led card is the ten of diamonds, the jack of diamonds (left bower) is not part of the led suit and cannot be played if you have any other diamonds.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1879-------------------------
what does the sort function do since we are sortiing cards not ints?

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>The <code>sort</code> function works the same for <code>int</code>s and <code>Card</code>s, actually - it just performs a sort using the <code>&lt;</code> operator to determine what values are smaller than others. The only change here is that we overload the <code>&lt;</code> operator in <code>Card.cpp</code> to tell the function how we want <code>Card</code>s to be compared.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

lead card question
<p>i took care of the case where the entire hand is trump cards, but if i did </p>

------------------------@1881-------------------------
Player Cosntructor
<p>Hi, I am a little stuck in terms of how to get Player started. I understand that I need to make a simple and a human player derived class from the player class. However, does this mean I have to implement a default constructor for Player? I am just a little confused on where to start. Thanks.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You will not have to do anything for the base <code>Player</code> class. The compiler will implicitly make a blank <code>Player()</code> constructor and call it in your derived classes. You will have to make constructors for your human and simple player classes, but you won’t have to worry about the <code>Player</code> class constructor at all.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1882-------------------------
Modify cin to read from .txt file
<p>I am currently writing test cases for HumanPlayer, and I've met an issue with cin. There's no console input on autograder, so I wonder how the player (autograder) inputs the card to play or drop</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>See the lesson here: <a data-pats="post_ref" href="1816" onclick="return PE.gotoPost('1816');">@1816</a>.</p>
<p>Basically, you can change <code>STDIN</code>/<code>cin</code> from the console input to a file from the command line when calling a function by putting <code>&lt; file_in</code> at the end of your command.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1883-------------------------
Should we test the operators?
<p>Just a little bit worry about whether it is necessary or required to test the overload operators lol...</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Yes, it’s always better to be safe than sorry, and the operators are used in many other parts of the function so if they have something wrong with them it’s much easier to find out now than in another function where it’s buried.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1884-------------------------
Help with understanding situation in euchre
<p>Right now, I'm trying to figure out how to play euchre and I think I mostly got it other than more a couple specific scenarios. Lets say the led card was an ace of hearts, the trump was diamonds, and in your hand was an ace of clubs, jack of diamonds, ten of spades, king of clubs, and nine of clubs. Would you have to play the jack of diamonds or could you play any card since the jack would be considered right bower and not the same suit as the led card?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You would have to play the jack of diamonds since it’s technically a heart (as it’s the left bower).</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Wouldn't the jack of diamonds be the right bower since the trump suit is diamonds and it would be considered diamonds, not hearts? I thought left and right bower were based off of what was trump.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>So sorry, that was my mistake, I misread it as saying the trump was hearts. You would be right, the Jack of Diamonds is a Jack (the right bower), and you would play whatever. If you are a simple player, you would play the nine of clubs.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1885-------------------------
Error with player_factory
<p>When I try to create a new player with the player factory I get an error saying "expected a type specifier". Not sure what this means.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
It depends on how you're trying to declare the new player. You shouldn't be doing new Player since Player is an abstract class. Make sure your simple and human player classes have constructors that set the player name. When you use new, ensure it's formatted like "new SimplePlayer(name)"

------------------------@1886-------------------------
Pack istream ctor
<p>Hello! I was able to successfully stream in the rank, the keyword of, and the suit for the Cards. When I ran the pack public tests, however, it came up saying that first_card is streamed in as the Two of Spades, not the Nine of Spades. Is there a way to make the istream start at nine of spades? Would I have to call a double for loop, as I currently am using a while loop.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>That’s odd. Are you sure that you are creating the <code>Card</code>s from only the input streamed in? In <code>pack.in</code> there isn’t a two anywhere - you should just be reading in ranks nine and up. Note that in the istream constructor you shouldn’t need to use the arrays <code>RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT</code> or <code>SUIT_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT</code>.</p></div>

------------------------@1887-------------------------
question about the card_less function
<p>Hi, I want to ask whether there could be two same cards for card_less function. For instance, both a and b are the left bower. Thank you!</p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>In an actual game of Euchre this wouldn’t happen but it could be tested. In this case, the function should return false since a card isn’t less than itself.</p></div>

------------------------@1888-------------------------
Upcasting Not Working With Simple and Player Class
<p>I am currently trying to implement the Player Factory function in player.cpp. However, every time I try to return new Simple(name), it tells me that the "conversion to inaccessible base class 'Player' is not allowed." Is this because the Player class is an ADT, or am I missing something? Any help would be appreciated. Thanks!</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Make sure that you are deriving from the base class <code>Player</code> using the <code>public</code> keyword.</p>
<pre><span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">Simple</span> : <span class="hljs-type">public Player {}</span></span>
<span class="hljs-comment">// not this:</span>
<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">Simple</span> : <span class="hljs-type">Player {}</span></span>
<div class="compile_code"><button class="compile_code_button" data-id="compileCodeBtnId" onclick="return PE.openCodeRunner('Y2xhc3MlMjBTaW1wbGUlMjA6JTIwcHVibGljJTIwUGxheWVyJTIwJTdCJTdEJTBBLy8lMjBub3QlMjB0aGlzOiUwQWNsYXNzJTIwU2ltcGxlJTIwOiUyMFBsYXllciUyMCU3QiU3RCUwQQ==');">run code snippet</button><div class="code_runner_notify">Visit Manage Class to disable runnable code snippets<button onclick="return PE.dismissCodeRunnerNotice();">×</button></div></div></pre><p>(found from <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47062562/conversion-to-inaccessible-base-class-is-not-allowed" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">here</a>)</p></div>

------------------------@1889-------------------------
Question about weights of cards
<p>For determining if a card is less than the other card when doing the operator&lt;, are there steps I need to go through? For example, do I check the weight of the suit of the card first then check the rank of the card?</p>


<p></p>


<p>For example:</p>


<p>ace_spades &lt; two_hearts = false</p>


<p>ace_spades = 14 + 1 = 15</p>


<p>two_hearts = 2 + 2 = 4</p>


<p></p>


<p>Do I do simple math, or do I check first based on the suit, then go to rank?</p>


<p>four_spades&lt; two_hearts = true because hearts is a greater rank than spades based on the definition of weight of suit as shown in card.h</p>


<p></p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Using math is actually kind of smart - don’t quote me on this but I think that strategy might work.</p>
<p>However, you might be a little confused on the ranking - the rank of the card takes priority, then the suit. Any four is always greater than any two. See the diagram and rules <a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#value-of-cards" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">here</a>.</p></div>

------------------------@1890-------------------------
test_card_insertion
<p>When I test Card.cpp in my terminal, I see that I am failing the "test_card_insertion" test case. Does anyone know which functions this test case refers to? I do not see it in Card.tests along with the other test cases. Thanks!</p>


<p></p>


<p></p>


<p><img alt="Screen_Shot_2022-10-08_at_11.33.25_PM.png" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fkeinf4wyl8f75i%2Fc3cf11d3f49f7dce42eecbbce4a689ba4916454f8383f0f7d1c2c6e0d4cd1558%2FScreen_Shot_2022-10-08_at_11.33.25_PM.png"/></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>The test case is at the bottom of <code>Card_public_tests.cpp</code>:</p>
<pre><code>TEST(test_card_insertion) {
  Card three_spades = Card(Card::RANK_THREE, Card::SUIT_SPADES);
  ostringstream oss;
  oss &lt;&lt; three_spades;
  ASSERT_EQUAL(oss.str(), "Three of Spades");
}
</code></pre><p>It tests that printing a card prints in the correct format. In other words, that your <code>operator&lt;&lt;</code> function was defined correctly.</p></div>

------------------------@1894-------------------------
make_trump false positive
<p>Inside of my test cases for the make_trump function, the autograder is giving me a false positive when I have the simple player pass in both round one and two. Do you have any tips on what could be the case? I tried debugging but I can't seem to find where it could go wrong.</p>


<p>Function Implementation:</p>


<p><img alt="image.png" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fkjopqhk8h1r5ly%2Fadd9afb0c5a82be2c1826ad96ed93c0fcf342ef7980eed5291719ecd33d8aee5%2Fimage.png"/></p>


<p>Test Cases that are showing up as false positives:</p>


<p><img alt="image.png" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fkjopqhk8h1r5ly%2F839029ab98abf2eee58bc164c71a555df3724029081aae60f0834dbdd42a3f55%2Fimage.png"/></p>

<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>In both cases, I think it is the second assert which is a false positive. Since the player is not ordering up any suit, trump would not be <code>SUIT_SPADES</code> or <code>SUIT_DIAMONDS</code>. You wouldn’t be able to assert that trump is a particular suit when the player does not order up.</p></div>

------------------------@1895-------------------------
Office Hours and Piazza Etiquette
<p dir="ltr">Hello Everyone!!</p>


<p dir="ltr">As you might have noticed/experienced last week with P2, Office Hours can get really long and busy as project deadlines approach. We just wanted to send out a few reminders about OH expectations &amp; etiquette moving forward so that we can make sure we’re able to help as many students as possible!</p>


<ul><li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">You must be in your meeting! If you have to quickly step out (ie. to use the restroom), leave us a note in the description on the queue and we will be mindful of that! If you're not there when it's your turn, we'll have to remove you from the queue so we can get to other students.</p>
</li><li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Out of fairness to students working individually on projects, the online queue will only allow one partner from a group to join at a time.</p>
</li><li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">We can’t guarantee finding an exact solution to every problem you might encounter. You are far more familiar with your code than we are, and sometimes all we can do is make suggestions of where to look.</p>
</li><li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">When the queue is busy, we will be limiting each student to 10 - 12 min each so more students can get help.</p>
</li><li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Narrowing down your problem and having your debugger up and running can make the most out of your OH time!</p>
<ul><li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">VSCode: <a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_vscode.html#run" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_vscode.html#run</a></p>
</li><li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">XCode: <a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_xcode.html#run" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_xcode.html#run</a></p>
</li><li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Visual Studio: <a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_visualstudio.html#run" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_visualstudio.html#run</a></p>
</li></ul>
</li></ul>


<p></p>


<p>For Piazza:</p>


<ul><li>If you are asking for feedback on your code, you <strong>MUST</strong> have include the full error message, what you have tried so far, and your uniquename in your piazza name (as seen in <a data-pats="post_ref" href="6" onclick="return PE.gotoPost('6');">@6</a>)</li></ul>


<p></p>


<p dir="ltr">We hope P3 is going well so far - feel free to join us in OH anytime &amp; we will be happy to help!</p>

------------------------@1897-------------------------
Test Fail--Leading Tricks in Player_tests.cpp
<p>Hi, for leading tricks in Player_tests.cpp, I consider a situation where the simple player only has trump(Hearts) cards, and he will play the leftbower(no rightbower) as the lead card right? But I continuously failed my test.<img alt="" height="72" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fl7b69no9x5g28c%2F31eaf0b3e8b44106cc4c634d6ca60b77fa306f9441e5f14461ef43ec4afdcbb3%2Fleft.png" width="587"/></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>From the spec:</p>
<blockquote>
<p>“When a Simple Player leads a trick, they play the highest non-trump card in their hand. If they have only trump cards, they play the highest trump card in their hand.”</p>
</blockquote>
<p>So, you are correct that if a player only has trump cards, they would lead with the left bower if they do not have the right bower. It is hard to say exactly why this is failing, but stepping through with your debugger may help! Also, double check that you are properly comparing cards (using <code>Card_less</code>) and the correct version of <code>get_suit()</code> for the given context to determine which card is the highest.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Thank you!! I got it.</p>

-------------------------------------------------

<p>This means that you have some behavior in your code that is causing some error, such as indexing out of bounds. When you get this error, check the call stack tab in VSCode and click on the last file/function in the stack that you modified. It should say something like Card::, Pack::, or Player::, and then some function.</p>

------------------------@1900-------------------------
Simpleplayer Player_factory states that get_name and is_trump functions have no overrider
<p>the function implementations do not have "override" nor "virtual" in pack.cpp. All other pure virtual functions do not have this error except these two. </p>


<p></p>


<p><img alt="" height="143" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fl7f84xtkw0q3u3%2F4e1dfdd5c1c4a5627c4ce74e94834794208daa24df517aaebf7050f78f5ae309%2Fsimpleplayer_compile_error.png" width="785"/></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Make sure that these functions have the <strong>exact</strong> same signatures as the ones in the <code>Player</code> class in <code>Player.h</code>, minus the <code>virtual</code> and <code>= 0</code> parts. For example, <code>make_trump</code> in your <code>SimplePlayer</code> class should look like</p>
<pre><span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">bool</span> <span class="hljs-title">make_trump</span><span class="hljs-params">(<span class="hljs-keyword">const</span> Card &amp;upcard, <span class="hljs-keyword">bool</span> is_dealer, <span class="hljs-keyword">int</span> round, <span class="hljs-built_in">std</span>::<span class="hljs-built_in">string</span> &amp;order_up_suit)</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">const</span> </span>{
  <span class="hljs-comment">/* code */</span>
}

------------------------@1901-------------------------

------------------------@1902-------------------------
bool operator <
<p>I'm having errors with the bool operator &lt; function test. I believe I wrote the tests correctly, and the function seems to be working fine after debugging... what is the issue? The first Assert is failing. <img alt="Screen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_1.58.21_AM.png" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fkt2b9bbjewsbt%2F7b52f588f83a539349437e14f008bc9332e04b3e49399eb85861c6be8a27d58d%2FScreen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_1.58.21_AM.png"/><img alt="Screen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_1.58.32_AM.png" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fkt2b9bbjewsbt%2Fab8cbc4ccdee9e6aad325eb026431d55acdcfd0ca70c0428043d507949ac11d3%2FScreen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_1.58.32_AM.png"/></p>

-------------------------------------------------
This is because the comparison is happening between 2 string values. lhs.get_rank() will return "Two" and rhs.get_rank() will return "Six". Alphabetically, S comes before T, hence Six (i e. Card b) is coming out to be lesser. 
<div>Would recommend giving the ranks and suits a weight (an integer) which will be helpful in comparing as right now they are just being compared alphabetically. </div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Should I put the integer weight in the constructors, or specifically the overloading operator function?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
In the operator function. If you need, you can even create a helper function for weights and call that in your overloading operator function 
<div>P.S. Do take a look at the Rank_names_by_weight and the suit_names_by_weight array defined in Card.h</div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1903-------------------------
Should I add virtual ~Player() {} in the derived class?
<p>Hi, I just submitted my project. For the two derived classes, I wrote one ending with</p>


<div>
<div>~SimplePlayer() {}. I don't know what it is for. Should I add
<div>
<div>~SimplePlayer() {} OR ~Player() {} at the end of each derived class?</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You shouldn’t need to add either, a tilde (~) before a class name as a function means that that is a destructor - or a function called when the class member is deleted. The Simple and Human player classes should just inherit the one from Player and not throw any errors.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1904-------------------------
Play Card Edge Case
<p>Say the players hand is as follows: Ace of Clubs, Ten of Clubs, Jack of Diamonds, Nine of Hearts, and Ace of Hearts.</p>


<p></p>


<p>Suppose that the led card's suit is hearts and that the trump suit is hearts as well.</p>


<p></p>


<p>I was confused whether or not the player is forced to play their Jack of Diamonds in their scenario.</p>


<p></p>


<p>I understand that since hearts is the trump, the Jack of Diamonds (left bower) is considered hearts as well.</p>


<p></p>


<p>Does this mean they have to play the Jack of Diamonds, given that it is the highest card they have with the same suit as the led card?</p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You are correct. The jack of diamonds is the highest card in their hand right now, it is trump, and it is a heart. After trump is declared, the left bower is for all cases within the game considered the trump suit.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1905-------------------------
Resolved
<p>Resolved</p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Marking resolved. In the future, it would be great if you could leave the issue up and just post a solution in the student answer section - that lets other people with the same issue know how to solve it!</p></div>

------------------------@1906-------------------------
confused on player.cpp
<p>I have made a derived class and my funcs have the same signature as player.h, but I am confused on how to do something as simple as return a name. How do I access the name to return? I have the same question for add_card(), how do I access the Player's hand? Am I missing something here? Thanks. </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>If you are trying to return a value that is stored in the class, you can just call the value by name. For example</p>
<pre><span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">A</span> </span>{
<span class="hljs-keyword">public</span>:
  <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">int</span> <span class="hljs-title">f</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span> </span>{
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> a;
  }
  <span class="hljs-keyword">private</span>:
    <span class="hljs-keyword">int</span> a;
}
<div class="compile_code"><button class="compile_code_button" data-id="compileCodeBtnId" onclick="return PE.openCodeRunner('Y2xhc3MlMjBBJTIwJTdCJTBBcHVibGljOiUwQSUyMCUyMGludCUyMGYoKSUyMCU3QiUwQSUyMCUyMCUyMCUyMHJldHVybiUyMGE7JTBBJTIwJTIwJTdEJTBBJTIwJTIwcHJpdmF0ZTolMEElMjAlMjAlMjAlMjBpbnQlMjBhOyUwQSU3RCUwQQ==');">run code snippet</button><div class="code_runner_notify">Visit Manage Class to disable runnable code snippets<button onclick="return PE.dismissCodeRunnerNotice();">×</button></div></div></pre><p>What happens behind the scenes is that the compiler will pass a <code>this</code> pointer to every function as a parameter and if it can’t find a variable that you reference, it will try to dereference <code>this</code> and find the variable inside of the class member.</p>
<p>In the example above, in the function <code>f()</code>, we reference a variable named <code>a</code> which we didn’t define in this scope. However, we do have a private member variable <code>a</code> which is part of the class the function is a part of. The compiler tries to resolve <code>a</code> by replacing it with <code>this-&gt;a</code>, which does work because <code>a</code> is a member variable of the class. This is how you’d return a member variable - you can read more <a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/notes/08_ADTs_in_C%2B%2B.html#implicit-this" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">here</a> if you’re still confused.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>The classes that inherit from Player don't have any private member variables. Add some private member variables to store information like a player's name and hand.</p>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1907-------------------------
Reading in in Player.cpp or Euchre.cpp
<p>For things like player name, ect., are we supposed to use cin and couts in the derived Human Player class of player.cpp or are we supposed to use cin in euchre.cpp and pass in things like name to human player? </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>The player names are passed as command line arguments and you should use them to create simple/human players.</p>
<p>https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#command-line-arguments</p></div>

------------------------@1908-------------------------
const = 0
<p>Why do the virtual functions of Player have a const = 0 at the end of their declarations? Am I supposed to do the same thing for my implementations?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
The “= 0” designates that the function is purely virtual. This is only applicable in the base player class.

-------------------------------------------------
<p><a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/notes/10_Polymorphism.html?highlight=pure%20virtual#abstract-classes-and-interfaces" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">Here </a>is an explanation of pure virtual from the lecture notes.</p>

------------------------@1911-------------------------
confused about wording for making trump round 2
<p>"During round two, a Simple Player considers ordering up the suit with the same color as the upcard, which would make that suit trump. They will order up if that would mean they have one or more cards that are either face or ace cards of the trump suit in their hand (the right and left bowers, and Q, K, A of the order-up suit). For example, if the upcard is a Heart and the player has the King of Diamonds in their hand, they will order up Diamonds. The Simple Player will not order up any other suit."</p>


<p></p>


<p>My understanding is:</p>


<p>during the second round, simple player only orders up if &gt;= 2 of their cards have the same suit as the upcard. I'm a bit confused about the "for example... they will order up diamonds" part.</p>


<p></p>


<p>But, say that the upcard is heart and the player has the king of diamond, wouldn't that require us to return false while keeping the order_up_suit undeclared?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>In round 2, the suit of the upcard is no longer in consideration for trump. Essentially, players are deciding if the suit that is the same color as the upcard will be trump. They will make that suit trump if &gt;= 1 of their cards is a face or ace card of that suit. If these conditions are met in round 2 (or the conditions to choose trump are fulfilled in round 1), make_trump will return true. Order_up_suit will be set to the suit that is chosen as trump, which is the upcard suit in round 1 or the suit that is the same color as the upcard in round 2. </p>


<p></p>


<p>In the example, diamonds is chosen as trump because diamonds is the same color as hearts (the upcard) and the player has at least one face or ace card in their hand.</p>


<p></p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>(not original poster) let's say its round 2 and its the dealer's turn and they don't have the same color as the trump. what do we return then ?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>If its the dealer and round 2, they will call up the same color suit as trump even if they don't have any.</p>

------------------------@1913-------------------------
lead card
<p>in lead card the left bower is also considered trump right, so you should not play it unless u only have trump cards maybe. but what if that </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>After the trump is decided, the left bower is considered trump for all purposes. Let’s say trump is diamonds and you have the jack of hearts. If diamonds is led, you have to play one of your trump cards, which includes the jack of hearts. If hearts is led, you cannot play the jack of hearts unless you have no other hearts.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>does this mean that if the hearts is led and you have no other other hearts so you put the jack of hearts done, do u win the trick?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>Yes.</p></div>

------------------------@1917-------------------------
Error message autograder
<p>My player runs and passes public tests in visual studio, returns this error in visual studio, could someone help with why? Thx</p>


<p></p>


<table><tbody><tr><td>1</td><td>Player.cpp:8:20: fatal error: player.h: No such file or directory</td></tr><tr><td>2</td><td>compilation terminated.</td></tr><tr><td>3</td><td>make: *** [Player-warning-check.s] Error 1</td></tr><tr><td>4</td></tr></tbody></table>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>The autograder is case sensitive for #include statements. Make sure you write <kbd>#include "Player.h"</kbd> not <kbd>#include "player.h"</kbd></p>

------------------------@1918-------------------------
how do I define a function inside a class in Card.h outside the class in Card.cpp??
<p>I am confused with how I would define the functions inside the Card.h file in my Card.cpp file. I am not declaring a Class in my cpp file right? Then how can I define a constructor? In lecture, we only learned how to define constructor inside the class itself, not outside of it in a separate file. Or am I missing something? A little help would be really appreciated.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You use the scope resolution operator <code>::</code> to tell the compiler what you are actually talking about. For example, in <code>Card.cpp</code> to declare the constructor for <code>Card</code>, you would write</p>
<pre><code>Card::Card() {}
</code></pre><p>as your function signature to tell the compiler you are declaring the function <code>Card()</code> in the class <code>Card</code> rather than the global scope in <code>Card.cpp</code>.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>That was helpful, thanks. Part of my question was also: How do I define a new constructor inside the class if I am just defining the function outside the class? Or do I not need it for this project?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>You shouldn’t need more than the two constructors in <code>Card.h</code>. However, if you were to create another constructor, you would need to change the <code>Card.h</code> file to include this constructor’s signature. In this project, we are not allowed to modify the header files, but if you could, you would add your new constructor signature there and then define it in <code>Card.cpp</code> accordingly.</p>
<p>For example:</p>
<pre><span class="hljs-comment">// --Card.h--</span>
<span class="hljs-comment">// our new constructor</span>
Card(<span class="hljs-built_in">std</span>::<span class="hljs-built_in">string</span>&amp; suit);

<span class="hljs-comment">// --Card.cpp--</span>
<span class="hljs-comment">// our new constructor definition</span>
Card::Card(<span class="hljs-built_in">std</span>::<span class="hljs-built_in">string</span> &amp;suit) : suit(suit), rank(<span class="hljs-string">"Two"</span>) {}
<div class="compile_code"><button class="compile_code_button" data-id="compileCodeBtnId" onclick="return PE.openCodeRunner('');">run code snippet</button><div class="code_runner_notify">Visit Manage Class to disable runnable code snippets<button onclick="return PE.dismissCodeRunnerNotice();">×</button></div></div></pre></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1920-------------------------
Writing Test Cases
<p>I'm not sure how to go about writing test cases for simple player, any hints or suggestions?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You should set up a game of euchre in your test cases with different hands for the player and see if they play the right cards given the situations. If you’re having trouble, you could always get a deck of cards or find one online and actually deal out a game of euchre to see what real situations would look like and how the flow of the game works.</p></div>

------------------------@1923-------------------------
Adding the Upcard and Discarding in human player
<p>is_dealer and round number isnt an argument for add_and_discard so how do we implement these aspects?</p>


<div>
<div></div>
</div>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You shouldn’t need to know these for <code>add_and_discard</code>. Add and discard is agnostic of what round the trump was called in, how it was called, etc. - It just considers the card passed as an argument and asks the human to get rid of one card in their hand.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>but the spec says </p>


<h4>Adding the Upcard and Discarding<a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#adding-the-upcard-and-discarding" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank"></a></h4>


<p><strong>If a Human Player is the dealer and someone orders up during the first round of making, the Human Player will pick up the upcard and discard a card of</strong> their choice. Print the Player’s hand and an option to discard the upcard. Then, prompt the user to select a card to discard. The user will then enter the number corresponding to the card they want to discard (or -1 if they want to discard the upcard).</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>This logic does not need to be in <code>add_and_discard</code>, the checking for this will be done in <code>euchre.cpp</code>. <code>add_and_discard</code> behaves with no knowledge of the state of the game other than the trump suit.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1924-------------------------
Pack Order after Hand
<p>What should be the pack order after a hand is played? Should the pack order reset to the order from the file provided before shuffling to start the second hand?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>In <a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#shuffle" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">EECS 280 Euchre Rules</a>, the spec says to shuffle the deck at the start of every hand. This is true unless <code>noshuffle</code> is specified, in which case you just reset the deck after every hand to what it initially was.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>So just to clarify, what order will the pack be in before we call shuffle at the start of the second hand?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>The same order it was in at the start of the first hand. Throughout the course of a trick, the order of the pack does not change. It is only shuffled and reset at the start of tricks.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1925-------------------------
'SimplePlayer' does not name a type
<p>My Player file fails to compile in Autograder with the above error on my constructor. It compiles fine on VSCode and CAEN, and I'm having trouble determining what's causing it.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Make sure you didn’t define the SimplePlayer class in the header file! When you run your code on your machine and on CAEN, it’s using your header files exactly, but ofc when you upload to AG it only uses your cpp files and uses the original header files.
Hope this helps.</p></div>

------------------------@1927-------------------------
How do I find the card I'm supposed to deal for deal_one()
<p>Hello! I'm currently working on the deal_one() function, and I'm wondering how I'm supposed to get the info on what the next card or current card is. After all, this thing is supposed to return the current card if I'm correct, but I don't know what function or value is supposed to help me find said card. If you know anything that could help with this, that'd be great.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>The private variable <code>next</code> in <code>Pack</code> should specify the index of the top-most card (the next card to be dealt). You should update this each time you deal a card and reset it when you shuffle or reset the deck.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Would an "empty" pack then be a pack where next is 25, and therefore all cards have been dealt</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>You’re on the right track! Double check which number specifically that would be.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>ah, 24 because it's 0-indexed. Thank you</p>

------------------------@1928-------------------------
What to return for lead_card and play_card
When I try to compile player.cpp it tells me that I need to have a return statement for lead_card and play_card and I would assume we are supposed to return the card we find. However, we are also supposed to erase that card from the hand. So how do I both return the card and erase the card?

-------------------------------------------------
<p>store the card you want to play in a new card that you create in the function and store the index of that card in another variable as well. then you can delete the card from the hand then return the card variable you created.</p>

------------------------@1930-------------------------
.erase() errors
<p>In my code, I use the .erase functions to delete a card from a hand after it is played. I keep getting an overloaded function error. Should I be using a different function or am I just using it wrong?</p>


<p></p>


<div>
<div>hand.erase(index);</div>
</div>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>If <code>hand</code> is a vector, it should be</p>
<pre><code>hand.erase(hand.begin() + index);
</code></pre></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>will the formula above erase the element at the index input or must we subtract one? It seems when I vary this on my code it makes no difference, but that makes me skeptical </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>It will erase at the index that you input so there's no need to subtract 1</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo1ooY"><p>Class definitions are statements so they need to end with a semicolon:</p>
<pre><span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">A</span> {</span>
  /* code <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> */</span>
};
<span class="hljs-regexp">//</span> more code out of <span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span></span>
<div class="compile_code"><button class="compile_code_button" data-id="compileCodeBtnId" onclick="return PE.openCodeRunner('Y2xhc3MlMjBBJTIwJTdCJTBBJTIwJTIwLyolMjBjb2RlJTIwaW4lMjBjbGFzcyUyMCovJTBBJTdEOyUwQS8vJTIwbW9yZSUyMGNvZGUlMjBvdXQlMjBvZiUyMGNsYXNzJTBB');">run code snippet</button><div class="code_runner_notify">Visit Manage Class to disable runnable code snippets<button onclick="return PE.dismissCodeRunnerNotice();">×</button></div></div></pre></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>You need a semicolon at the end of you class definition, similar to structs, so something like this:</p>


<p></p>


<pre><span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">Simple</span>:</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> Player{
<span class="hljs-comment">//some stuff in here</span>

Segmentation fault
<p><img alt="Screenshot_2022-10-09_at_4.29.25_PM.pngNaN" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fky7glpqju74757%2Fa683c9fa0f2689577930f58e9f5e55ab28e066d4fbd8bde17e9da5cc2eb750a2%2FScreenshot_2022-10-09_at_4.29.25_PM.png"/></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>some hands don't always have 5 cards in them. If you're iterating through 5 cards in Player try using hand.size() instead. See <a data-pats="post_ref" href="1857" onclick="return PE.gotoPost('1857');">@1857</a>, segmentation faults are usually caused by going out of bounds.</p>

------------------------@1934-------------------------
Way to test derived class constructors
<p>I am currently working on writing test cases for the Player file, and I want to be able to test the derived class constructors to make sure they work. How would I go about doing this? <pre><span class="hljs-comment">// -- Player.cpp --</span>
<span class="hljs-comment">// if the signature of your constructor looks like this:</span>
Simple(<span class="hljs-keyword">const</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">std</span>::<span class="hljs-built_in">string</span> name){};

<span class="hljs-comment">// -- Player_tests.cpp --</span>
<span class="hljs-comment">// you should initialize like this:</span>
<span class="hljs-function">Simple <span class="hljs-title">s</span><span class="hljs-params">(<span class="hljs-string">"name"</span>)</span></span>;

------------------------@1938-------------------------
Shuffle
<p>My partner and I are thinking about creating an array of card pointers that point to the sorted cards. Then we would increment the ptrs to the shuffle pattern described in the specs. Is this a good way to think about implementing shuffle?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>You shouldn’t be dealing with pointers or dynamic memory outside of <code>Player_factory</code>. It makes it easier to find bugs and may lead to memory leaks. While it may work, and <em>might</em> be more efficient, code quality is more important in this class and it would likely be better to instead move around the indices of the cards in the array.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1942-------------------------

------------------------@1946-------------------------
Creating classes in .cpp
<p>I understand we're not supposed to modify header files for this class, but I don't understand why we would then be told to declare classes inside a .cpp file -- it's generally considered bad practice as it removes a layer of protection from the class. I get that this is meant to prevent us from accidentally modifying the classes, but I feel at this point, we really should be capable of implementing a class correctly, with declarations and implementations in separate files as it should be. I'm not saying this to be critical, but it's just one or two extra files, which wouldn't be much extra work for the autograder to check or any of us to write, and it would also be good just for us to be familiar with writing code for classes in the way it's typically implemented professionally. Just a suggestion!</p>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1947-------------------------
Going over MAX_HAND_SIZE in add_and_discard()
<p>How do we account for adding a card, which would change the max hand size to 6, before removing the card in add_and_discard?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Instead of adding the card first, find the card you are going to remove, and just swap it with what you are adding. No need to use erase() or what not I believe, that should only have to be used in lead_card and play_card since you don't pick up a card.</p>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1948-------------------------
Possible Issue with static and dynamic memory
<p>In testing Player.cpp, I am using a helper function that returns the player's hand:</p>


<p><img alt="Screen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_6.09.41_PM.png" height="74" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fl7ksdbjv4ns6ni%2F269e8fdaa7ada4d595effd92ee44b44c31b7be0ea47a57e4ff5486f81360533c%2FScreen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_6.09.41_PM.png" width="299"/></p>


<p>This is my code in Player_tests: (I have made a SimplePlayer named roger that has five cards in his hand)</p>


<p><img alt="Screen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_6.10.20_PM.png" height="32" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fl7ksdbjv4ns6ni%2F06caee5b82499274022f03134da54c138baf3d9520913345f233ff44c5792974%2FScreen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_6.10.20_PM.png" width="385"/></p>


<p>The compiler tells me that " class Player has no member "get_hand()" "</p>


<p>I think this is an issue with dynamic vs static memory. As far as I know, roger's static type is Player but Dynamic type is SimplePlayer. Doesn't that mean that roger should have access to get_hand()? What could be the issue here?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>It's telling you that the Player class doesn't have the member function get hand, which it doesn't -- its a helper function that you created. In order for this function to work, you have to put the word static in front of it. This will give the function internal linkage, so it won't throw that linking error. Get_hand by itself doesn't have access to the class variables because it's not declared inside the class (its a helper function), so you have to first declare it inside of simple player, and then define it inside then file like so.</p>


<p></p>


<p></p>


<p>static const vector&lt;Card&gt; &amp; Player::get_hand() const</p>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1949-------------------------
For Card::Card() and Card::Card(const std::string &rank_in, const std::string &suit_in)
<p>Should we be calling get_rank() and get_suit() for these two functions or can we call rank and suit?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>If you look in Card.h file, the Card class has two private member variables, rank and suit. You can set these equal to the rank and suit you want in Card() and Card(rank_in, suit_in). No need to call get_rank() and get_suit(). </p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>So I tried doing</p>


<p></p>


<p>Card Card(rank_in, suit_int);</p>


<p></p>


<p>so that the default constructor can take this value and set the members accordingly. But it isn't working. What am I doing wrong here?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>You should just set the variables rank and suit equal to rank_in and suit_in individually. What you are doing now is trying to call the Card constructor you are writing into itself. However, you will call the Card constructor like in your comment in Pack.cpp</p>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1950-------------------------
Lead card with trump parameter
<p>This might be a silly question but what do we do with the trump input in lead_card? I accounted for trump in my card_less function so I'm not sure how to implement trump into the lead_card function in Player.cpp.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>As the <a href="https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#leading-tricks" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">spec describes</a>, the <code>SimplePlayer::lead_card()</code> function will:</p>
<blockquote>
<p>play the highest non-trump card in their hand. If they have only trump cards, they play the highest trump card in their hand.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Implementing this requires checking if there is a trump card in the hand, and then taking the appropriate action. If there are any non-trump cards, play the lowest card. If there are only trump cards, play the highest trump card. The <code>trump</code> input is used for each of these steps.</p></div>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>thanks! I was wondering about this primarily for the human player function as well, how would I implement trump there?</p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>The human player decides what card they want to lead with, there are no restrictions because they are leading (don't have to follow suit). Just return the card the human player plays.</p>

------------------------@1953-------------------------
Pack.cpp failing tests
<p>My partner and I submitted to autograder. We failed all the public tests and aren't sure what's wrong or if we are implementing the functions correctly.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>One thing that might be causing you to fail is your Pack constructor. The next member variable is used to know what card is next to be dealt; it doesn't need to be incremented in your constructor. </p>


<p></p>


<p>Try running the Pack public tests on your own computer. Make sure the Pack you creates looks like the one in the <code>pack.in</code> file.  See which assert statements fail and use your debugger to identify what changes need to be made.</p>

------------------------@1954-------------------------
Pack Testing
<p>Should we also be testing pack.cpp in player_tests.cpp since we're not pack tests? Or does the autograder only test buggy card and player implementations. Because I've written a lot of player tests and can't seem to get any more bugs.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>Your tests for <code>Pack</code> should go in <code>Pack_tests.cpp</code>. That’s why it was provided as a starter file. I can’t speak to what the autograder will test, but you shouldn’t put <code>Pack</code> tests in with <code>Player</code> tests, since that defeats the purpose of having separate files.</p></div>

------------------------@1955-------------------------
Quesitons about deal_one
<p>My partner and I are confused on how to go about writing deal_one. We essentially just return cards[next++] but we get an out of bounds error. -------------------------------------------------
<p>Make sure you initialize next in your Pack constructor. If it doesn't get explicitly initialized, it gets assigned some random value that won't work as an index.</p>

------------------------@1958-------------------------
does get_suit(trump) need to call get_suit() and get_rank()?
<p>Do we use get_rank() and get_suit() in get_suit(trump) or can we use rank and suit?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p><code>Card::get_suit(trump)</code> is a member function of the <code>Card</code> class, just like <code>Card::get_suit()</code> and <code>Card::get_rank()</code>, so it can access the private variables directly.</p></div>

------------------------@1961-------------------------
print function return
<p>I keep getting an error saying that the last print function in Player needs to return something, but I am not quite sure what it needs to return.</p>


<p></p>


<div>
<div>std::ostream &amp; operator&lt;&lt;(std::ostream &amp;os, const Player &amp;p){</div>
</div>

-------------------------------------------------
<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p><code>std::ostream &amp; operator&lt;&lt;()</code> just modifies tho <code>ostream</code> that is passed in. Like it says in the RME in <code>Player.h</code>, the function should print the <code>Player</code>’s name to <code>os</code>. Then you return <code>os</code>. Notice how the return type and <code>os</code> both had the same type of <code>ostream&amp;</code>.</p></div>

------------------------@1962-------------------------
run player error
<p><img alt="Screen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_7.55.43_PM.pngNaN" height="54" src="/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&amp;prefix=paste%2Fksxjcu6h3jv419%2F7a8a808fc2d7fbbb8ab0201c756f0ef21a006af4b58e41e0dd459e080bf269d0%2FScreen_Shot_2022-10-09_at_7.55.43_PM.png" width="1125"/></p>


<p>When I try running Player tests or the public tests, i keep getting repeated instances of this error. How do I fix this?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>I can't tell exactly where this error is coming from, but if you are calling sort() in your make trump function in the human class, I would assume that's where the error is coming from. (Again not sure if you are doing sort() there but follow-up if you need more info on how to fix it)</p>


<p></p>


<p>Edit: for other students who may encounter this issue, swap() is a function that is used in the std::sort function, Normally this error comes from make_trump  in the Human class since make_trump is const, we can't change the private members of the class, so the usual workaround is to create a temporary vector, copy your hand of cards into this temporary vector, and sort/print this temporary vector instead. (This is only necessary for make_trump since it's the only function that is const)</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>I checked my sort functions and they’re written like how they are in the specs and there’s none in the make trump function, but I’m still having errors</p>


<p></p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>In which functions are you using sort()?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Just the print hand function that I wrote in my human class.</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>And in which functions are you calling your print hand function?</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>make trump, add and discard, lead card, play card</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Interesting, so technically if you are calling sort() in your printhand() function, and you are calling printhand() in your make_trump() function, you are basically sorting the hand within make_trump. The problem with this is that make_trump has const after it, meaning that we can't change our class member variables within this function. We also can't take off the const after the function declaration because it needs to match what is in the Player.h file. You can work around this issue by creating a temporary vector, then copy the cards from the hand vector into the temporary vector, then just sort and print the temporary vector.</p>


<p></p>


<p>Hope this helps!</p>

-------------------------------------------------
<p>Additionally, make sure you are declaring the copied hand inside of make_trump, do not declare it as a private member variable of HumanPlayer class like hand or you will get same error. Also do not use sort() in print_hand, you will get same error, just sort it before you call print_hand in the functions. </p>

-------------------------------------------------

------------------------@1965-------------------------
player.cpp assert undefined

<div class="markdown" id="q38kRj58oo0ooY"><p>If your IDE says that the <code>assert()</code> function is undefined, then you should add the <code>#include &lt;cassert&gt;</code> directive to the top of your <code>Player.cpp</code>.</p></div>

Weirdly enough, moving the <code>#include &lt;cassert&gt;</code> to the top of all the <code>include</code> statements worked (making it the first one). Don’t know if this is your issue but hope it helps.</p></div>
